list.title: circle
list.description: The circle function allows to add circles on a map. The function adds a layer to the SVG container and returns the layer identifier. If the container is not defined, then the layer is displayed directly.

list.title: create
list.description: The create function is the first step in map construction. It creates an svg container + some information about this container:projection, margin, width, height and bbox.

list.title: draw
list.description: The draw() function is inspired by the bertin library. It allows you to draw the entire map using a single function. All the necessary information is stored in a single JSON, containing general parameters and an array of objects describing the layers to be displayed and overlaid. Under the wood, the function draw() use the viz.plot() function. The types available are the same.

list.title: effect/blur
list.description: The blur function allows to create a svg blur filter. It adds a filter to the defs and returns the id like "url(#id)".

list.title: effect/clipPath
list.description: The clipPath function allows to create a clip layer. The function adds a clip layer to the SVG container and returns the id like "url(#id)". WARNING - the clip is valid for the entireweb page, not just the map

list.title: effect/radialGradient
list.description: The radialGradient function allows to create a radialGradient. The function adds a filter to the defs and returns the id like "url(#id)".

list.title: effect/shadow
list.description: The shadow function allows to create a svg filter. It can be use ta add a shadow effect. The function adds a filter to the defs and returns the id like "url(#id)".

list.title: footer

list.title: grid/make

list.title: plot
list.description:
The plot() function in geoviz allows you to call up all the layer types available in the library via a single function. To do this, you need to define the type in the parameter.

For example: geoviz.plot({type: "graticule", step: 30})

list.title: plot/choro
list.description: With the plot({type = "choro"}) function, you can quickly draw a choropleth map.

list.title: plot/prop
list.description: With the plot({type = "prop"}) function, you can quickly draw a choropleth map.

list.title: plot/propchoro
list.description: With the plot({type = "propchoro"}) function, you can quickly draw a proportional symbols with a color gradation/

list.title: plot/proptypo
list.description: With the plot({type = "proptypo"}) function, you can quickly draw a proportional symbols with qualitative colors (hues)

list.title: plot/symbol
list.description: With the plot({type = "symbol"}) function, you can quickly draw a layer with symbols.

list.title: plot/typo
list.description: With the plot({type = "typo"}) function, you can quickly draw a typlogy from qualitative data.

list.title: render
list.description: The render function returns the svg document. It returns a pretty map in SVG format :-)

list.title: rhumbs
list.description: The rhumbs function allows to display "rhumb lines" like on old portolan charts

list.title: scalebar
list.description: The scalebar function allows add a scalebar. The function adds a layer to the SVG container and returns the layer identifier. If the container is not defined, then the layer is displayed directly.

list.title: spike
list.description: The spike function allows to create a layer with spikes from a geoJSON. The function adds a layer to the SVG container and returns the layer identifier. If the container is not defined, then the layer is displayed directly.

list.title: square
list.description: The square function allows to create a layer with rotable squares from a geoJSON. The function adds a layer to the SVG container and returns the layer identifier. If the container is not defined, then the layer is displayed directly.

list.title: symbol
list.description: The symbol function allows to create a layer with symbols from a geoJSON. The function adds a layer to the SVG container and returns the layer identifier. If the container is not defined, then the layer is displayed directly.

list.title: text
list.description: The text function allows to add a text on the map. It allow also to create a layer with labels from a geoJSON. The function adds a layer to the SVG container and returns the layer identifier. If the container is not defined, then the layer is displayed directly.

list.title: tile
list.description: The tile function allows to display raster tiles. To use this mark, you must use the projection d3.geoMercator() (or directly "mercator"). The function adds a layer to the SVG container and returns the layer identifier. If the container is not defined, then the layer is displayed directly.

list.title: tip
list.description: The tip parameter allows to add tooltips on map layers

list.title: tissot
list.description: The tissot function aims to draw Tissot circles to visualize the deformations due to the projection

list.title: tool/addonts
list.description: The tool.addonts function allows add font to the document from an url.

list.title: tool/centroid
list.description: The tool.centroid function calculate the centroid of all the geometries given in a GeoJSON FeatureCollection. It returns a GeoJSON FeatureCollection (points)

list.title: tool/choro
list.description: The tool.choro function discretizes an array of numbers. It returns an object containing breaks, colors, the color of the missing value and a function.

list.title: tool/dissolve
list.description: The tool.dissolve function aims to transform multi part features into single parts feature. It a GeoJSON FeatureCollection (without multi part features)

list.title: tool/dodge
list.description: The tool.dodge function use d3.forceSimulation to spread dots or circles of given in a GeoJSON FeatureCollection (points). It returns the coordinates in the page map. It can be used to create a dorling cartogram. The function returns a GeoJSON FeatureCollection (points) with coordinates in the page map.

list.title: tool/dotstogrid
list.description: dotstogrid is a function to create a regular grid in the SVG plan count the number of dots inside

list.title: tool/featurecollection
list.description: tool.featurecollection is a function to create a valid GeoJSON FeatureCollection, from geometries, features or coordinates. It returns a GeoJSON FeatureCollection.

list.title: tool/geotable
list.description: geotable is a function to create an array on objects containing properties and geomeytries, froam a GeoJSON FeatureCollection. This makes it easy to sort, extract data, etc. tool.featurecollection(geotable, { geometry: "geometry" }) can be used to rebuild a valid geoJSON. The function returns an array of an array of FeatureCollections.

list.title: tool/height
list.description: This function return a function to calculate radius of circles from data. It returns an object containing a radius function.

list.title: tool/merge
list.description: tool.merge is a function to join a geoJSON and a data file. It returns a GeoJSON FeatureCollection.

list.title: tool/proj4d3
list.description: proj4d3 is a function developped by Philippe Rivière to allow tu use proj4js projections with d3. It returns a d3js projection function. See https://observablehq.com/@fil/proj4js-d3

list.title: tool/project
list.description: The function tool.project use geoproject from d3-geo-projection to project a geoJSON. It returns a GeoJSON FeatureCollection with coordinates in the page map.

list.title: tool/radius
list.description: The tool.radius function return a function to calculate radius of circles from data

list.title: tool/random
list.description: The tool.random function returns a random color among 20 predefined colors.

list.title: tool/replicate
list.description: Data-driven features replication. This function can be used to create "dots cartograms". The function returns a GeoJSON FeatureCollection with overlapping features

list.title: tool/rewind
list.description: The tool.rewind function allows to generate compliant Polygon and MultiPolygon geometries. Adapted from MapBox geojson-rewind code (https://github.com/mapbox/grojson-rewind) under ISC license

list.title: tool/ridge
list.description: The tool.ridge function convert a regular grid (x,y,z) to a GeoJSON FeatureCollection (LineString). The aim is to draw a rideline map.

list.title: tool/symbols
list.description: Display symbols available in geoviz

list.title: tool/typo
list.description: The tool.typo function allows you to assign colors to qualitative data. It can be used to create typology maps. It returs an object containing types, colors, the color of the missing value and a function.

list.title: tool/unproject
list.description: The tool.unproject function allow to unproject geometries. It returns a GeoJSON FeatureCollection with wgs84 coordinates
